growbox.head: Size Object
growbox.text: Drag this box to change an object's size

inspectorbutton.head: Object Action Menu
inspectorbutton.text: Click this button to show the action menu for an object

objectlistbutton.head: Object List Button
objectlistbutton.text: Click this button to see a list of objects by category

allowmodwarning.text: Warning: Saving this file will replace any #1-#9 arguments with their current values. This can be prevented by saving the file before modifying.

template.head: New Template
template.text: Create a new patcher window from a Template file

windsaveasproject.head: Save As Project
windsaveasproject.text: Save the current patcher as a Project file

exportimage.head: Export Image
exportimage.text: Export a PNG image file of the current patcher window

copycompressed.head: Copy Compressed
copycompressed.text: Copy the selection to the clipboard in compressed text format

dependencies.head: Dependencies
dependencies.text: Show the Dependencies Window for the current patcher

patcherdrawer.head: Sidebar
patcherdrawer.text: Show or hide patcher Sidebar which contains the Max window, Inspector, Reference, and Object Explorer

showstatusbar.head: Status Bar
showstatusbar.text: Show or hide the Status Bar

showtoolbar.head: Toolbar
showtoolbar.text: Show or hide the patcher Toolbar

showfg.head: Foreground
showfg.text: Show or hide the foreground layer of objects in the patcher

showcpuusage.head: CPU Usage
showcpuusage.text: Show the CPU usage for signal processing in the patcher, green (low) to red (high)

defineinitialposition.head: Define Fixed Initial Window Location
defineinitialposition.text: Sets the patcher's initial window location

setdefaults.head: Set to Default Values
setdefaults.text: Set object colors to default values

prototype.head: Prototype
prototype.text: Create a prototype of the selected object

align_auto.head: Auto Align
align_auto.text: Align multiple objects to the left/topmost object's top or left edges

align_left.head: Left
align_left.text: Align the selected objects to the left/topmost object's left edge

align_center.head: Center
align_center.text: Align the selected objects to the left/topmost object's center

align_right.head: Right
align_right.text: Align the selected objects to the left/topmost object's right edge

align_top.head: Top
align_top.text: Align the selected objects to the left/topmost object's top edge

align_middle.head: Middle
align_middle.text: Align the selected objects to the middle of each object

align_bottom.head: Bottom
align_bottom.text: Align the selected objects to the lowest object's bottom edge

snaptoobjects.head: Snap to Objects
snaptoobjects.text: Constrain the movement of objects so they fall onto near object's patcher placement

route.head: Route Patch Cords
route.text: Route the placement of patch cords so that they avoid other objects

lineupconnections.head: Align Connections
lineupconnections.text: Align objects to snap to the inlet/outlet it is connected to

removesegments.head: Remove All Segments
removesegments.text: Remove all segments from a segmented patch cord

segpatchcords.head: Segmented Patch Cords
segpatchcords.text: Draw segmented patch cords â€” connections that have joints

glstatus.head: OpenGL Status
glstatus.text: Open the OpenGL Status window to see properties of the graphics card on this computer

linedisable.head: Disable Patch Cord
linedisable.text: Disable the currently selected patch cord(s)

lineenable.head: Enable Patch Cord
lineenable.text: Enable the currently selected patch cord(s)

doclive.head: Max for Live
doclive.text: Show the Max For Live Documentation in the Reference Browser window

dialog.text: Show the inspector for the selected objects

newtext.head: New Text
newtext.text: Create a new text editor window

newtable.head: New Table
newtable.text: Create a new table editor window

template.head: New Patcher From Template
template.text: Create a new patcher using the chosen template file as a starting point

newfromclipboard.text: Paste the contents of the clipboard into a new patcher window

newfilebrowser.text: Open a new file browser window

jopen.text: Open an existing patcher, text file, or collective file

openastext.text: Open the source for a patcher in a text window

allowmod.head: Modify Read-only
allowmod.text: Permit a patcher loaded as an abstraction to be edited. If disabled, the current patcher window was not loaded as an abstraction.

windsaveas.text: Save the current window with a new name

savecoll.text: Save the current window as a self-contained file or an application

savedefault.text: Save the current window as a template to be used when making a new patcher

midisetup.text: Assign MIDI input and output ports to channel ranges and letter abbreviations

listfiles.text: List of all the patcher files and external objects used by the current patcher in the Max window

install.text: Load an external object. This is normally done when you create a new instance of an object.

cut.text: Delete the selection and copy it to the clipboard

copy.text: Copy the selection to the clipboard

paste.text: Paste the contents of the clipboard into the current window

contextualpaste.text: Paste the contents of the clipboard into the current window at the location where you clicked

selectall.text: Select everything in the current window

pastepic.text: Create an fpic object in the patcher with the image currently on the clipboard

pastereplace.text: Replace the currently selected objects with the object on the clipboard

encapsulate.text: Transform the currently selected objects into a subpatcher

deencapsulate.text: Transform the currently selected subpatcher into objects in the current patcher

find.text: Show the Find bar in the current window

findprev.text: Select the previous item that matches the current Find criteria

findnext.text: Select the next item that matches the current Find criteria

resume.text: After the scheduler has been stopped, restart it. This item is only enabled after a stack overflow has occurred.

newview.text: Open another view of a patcher

edit.head: Lock / Unlock
edit.text: Lock or unlock the patcher window. If this is disabled, it means this patcher cannot be edited.

objectpalette.text: Open the Object Explorer allowing you to choose a new object that will be created in the center of the patcher window

showbg.text: Change the visiblity of the background layer of objects in the patcher

lockbg.text: Prevent the editing of the background layer of objects in the patcher, permitting you to place objects on top of the background layer

navigate.text: Open a resizable window in the bottom right corner of the patcher window allowing to zoom in and out and scroll the visible area of the patcher

showconnections.text: Make patch cords visible when the patcher is unlocked

hideconnections.text: Make patch cords invisible when the patcher is unlocked

presentation.text: Switch between presentation and patching modes. Presentation mode is an easier way to create a user interface for your patcher

forward.text: Move the selected objects' front-to-back ordering one step toward the front. If objects are selected and this is disabled, it means the objects are already at the front.

backward.text: Move the selected objects' front-to-back order one step toward the back. If objects are selected and this is disabled, it means the objects are already in the back.

savequery.head: Save File Browser Search
savequery.text: Save the current search criteria as a search in your file listings.

deletequery.head: Remove File Browser Search
deletequery.text: Remove the currently selected search from your file listings.  You can only remove custom searches that have been added, built-in searches are not removable.

showpreview.head: Hide/Show Preview
showpreview.text: Change whether or not the preview pane is visible in the lower portion of the FileBrowser window.

editmetadata.head: Edit Metadata for Selected Object
editmetadata.text: Open the Metadata Editor window for the selected object.

revealinfinder.head: Reveal Selected Object
revealinfinder.text: Show the selected file in your file system using the Finder or Windows Explorer.

addmetadata.head: Add Metadata
addmetadata.text: Create a new metadata entry for this file.  You can then edit the metadata type (tag, author, or an arbitrary type of your choosing) and value.

deletemetadata.head: Remove Selected Metadata
deletemetadata.text: Remove the currently selected metadata for the object

preferences.text: Edit user interface and real-time performance settings

patcherinspector.text: Open an inspector window to edit settings that apply to an entire patcher

grid.text: Show or hide the patcher's grid lines when the patcher is unlocked

snaptogrid.text: Constrain the movement of objects so they fall onto grid lines

navigate.text: Open a small window in the corner of a patcher allowing you to change the visible area of the patcher by dragging or changing the size of the blue outlined box

fixwidth.text: Match the width of a text object to the width of its current text. For non-text objects, Fix Width will return the object to its default size

lineup.text: When objects are selected, Align matches their closest sides. When a patch cord is selected, Align straightens it, routing it around boxes if necessary.

dialog.text: Open the inspector window for the selected objects, where you can edit attributes

colorpopup.text: Open a color palette for changing the basic color of the selected objects or patch cords

wobjectname.text: Edit an object's name for use with pattr objects or patcher scripting

defaults.text: Configure the default colors of patcher objects

hide.text: Make the selected objects disappear when the patcher is locked

show.text: Make the selected objects visible when the patcher is locked

bfront.text: Move the selected objects ahead of all other objects. If this command is disabled, it means the selected objects are already at the front.

back.text: Move the selected objects behind all other objects. If this command is disabled, it means the selected objects are already at the back.

ignoreclick.text: Set the selected objects to ignore mouse clicks

respondtoclick.text: Set the selected objects to respond to mouse clicks

includebg.text: Move the selected objects from the foreground (default) layer to the background layer

excludebg.text: Move the selected objects from the background layer to the foreground layer

addtopresentation.text: Add the selected objects to the presentation, where their size and position can be changed independently

removefrompresentation.text: Remove the selected objects from the presentation

saveprototype.text: Save the selected object's settings so you can create a copy from the circular menu or by applying to another object using the Prototype menu

prototype.text: Apply stored settings to the selected object

showfontpanel.text: Show or hide the font panel to change font settings on the selected object or topmost window

sendmessage.text: Open a dialog where you can type in a message to send to the selected objects

overdrive.text: Overdrive is a scheduler mode that runs timing objects in a high-priority thread, resulting in more accuracy and less interference from other computer tasks

allwindowsactive.text: When enabled, clicks in an inactive window operate the window without bringing it to the front.

autofixwidth.text: Auto Fix Width changes the width of text object boxes as you type

floatdisplaycorrection.text: When enabled, floating-point numbers are rounded when displayed if they are close to an integer value

helpinlockedpatchers.text: When enabled, option-clicking on an object in a locked patcher brings up its help file. When disabled, this only happens in an unlocked patcher.

assistance.text: When enabled, bubbles appear to describe objects' inlets and outlets when you move the cursor over them. When disabled, the descriptions appear in the clue window.

dspstatus.text: Open the Audio Status window where you can change audio driver and performance settings.

iomap.text: Edit the mapping between dac~ and adc~ channels and device channels

driversetup.text: Open the setup window for the currently selected audio driver

filepreferences.text: Open the File Preferences window where you can add folders to the Max search path.

traceenable.text: When debugging is enabled, execution of a patch will stop at any active breakpoints.

showdebugger.text: Open the Debug window, which shows the current program state when stopped at a Break Watchpoint.

showwiretaps.text: Open the Watchpoints window listing all currently active Break and Monitor Watchpoints.

tracestep.text: When program execution is stopped, Step sends the next pending message out an outlet, then suspends execution again.

tracecontinue.text: When program execution is stopped, Continue resumes normal execution. Execution may stop again if another Break Watchpoint is encountered.

traceabort.text: When program execution is stopped, Abort cancels any further execution.

traceautostep.text: When program execution is stopped, Auto Step begins executing by triggering the next pending message every two seconds, permitting you to watch your patch in slow motion.

tracepause.text: If a patch is executing, Pause stops it and shows where execution is suspended in the Debug Window.

addbreakpoint.text: Add a break watchpoint (which will suspend execution when debugging is enabled) to the selected patch cord.

addwiretap.text: Add a monitor watchpoint to the selected patch cord to record messages passing through it that you can observe in the Watchpoints window.

removewiretap.text: Remove the watchpoint from the selected patch cord

removeallwiretaps.text: Remove all watchpoints from all patchers

debugpanel.text: Show the internal Max debugging control panel.

probeenable.text: When Probing is enabled, Max displays signal or matrix data from the patch cord under the cursor in a locked patcher.

showmatrixprobe.text: Show the Matrix Probe window that displays current matrix data transmitted through the patch cord under the cursor in a locked patcher.

extra.text: Extras are helpful utilities. You can add your own by placing them in the extras folder inside the patches folder.

nextwindow.text: Bring the window ahead of the topmost window in the window list to the front

previouswindow.text: Bring the window behind the topmost window in the window list to the front

cascade.text: Arrange windows in a cascade pattern

tilehorizontally.text: Arrange windows in a horizontal tile pattern

tilevertically.text: Arrange windows in a vertical tile pattern

hidesubs.text: Close any open subpatcher windows of the topmost patcher window

sendwindowtoback.text: Move the window behind all other open windows

minimize.text: Reduce the window to the bottom of the screen

zoomwindow.text: Toggle between full-screen and a window's normal size

minimizeall.text: Reduce all windows to the bottom of the screen

bringalltofront.text: Move all windows in front of the windows of other applications

showclue.text: Show the floating clue window, which must already be visible if you are reading this text

maxwindow.text: Show the Max window, which lists error messages and the output of the print object

window.text: Choose a window by name to bring it to the front

help.text: Open the help file for the selected object

reference.text: Open the reference manual page for the selected object

queryselected.text: Display a query performed on the selected object's name in a file browser window

zoomin.text: Magnify the topmost patcher window by about 10 percent

zoomout.text: Zoom out the topmost patcher window by about 10 percent

showat100percent.text: Restore the zoom level of the topmost patcher window to 100%. If this item is disabled, it means the window is currently shown at 100%.

pastefrom.text: Paste the contents of the selected file at the location where you clicked to show this contetual menu

selecttool.head: Select Tool
selecttool.text: Select a range of table values for copy and paste

linetool.head: Line Tool
linetool.text: Make a smooth linear ramp of table values

handtool.head: Move Tool
handtool.text: Scroll the displayed area of a table

sortbytime.head: Order by Time
sortbytime.text: Sort messages in the Max window by the order in which they were originally displayed

maxclearall.head: Clear All
maxclearall.text: Clear the entire contents of the Max window

addattr.text: Store arbtirary named data with an object

addpath.text: Add a new folder to the search path. Use the Choose button that appears to pick the folder.

removeattr.text: Delete the previously added instance attribute that is currently selected

removepath.text: If the selected path is the last one in the list, Remove Path will delete it. Otherwise, Remove Path will clear its value but leave the path listed. In both cases, the path is removed from the search path.

reveal.text: Point out the object responsible for the selected message

attr_reveal.text: Point out the object(s) being inspected

clientcontext.text: Menu items specific to the selected object

freeze.text: Store the current value as the saved value of the attribute, immune from any changes to the attribute's value

unfreeze.text: Remove a special saved value for the attribute

dialog_sender.text: Open the inspector on the object that sent the currently selected message

dialog_receiver.text: Open the inspector on the object that received the currently selected message

reveal_sender.text: Point out the object that sent the currently selected message

loadskin.text: Load a collection of object default settings

saveskin.text: Save the current object default settings in a file

listpaths.text: Print all of the current search paths in the Max window

docintro.text: Open the main start page for the Max documentation

docnew.text: Information about new features in Max 5

doctesting.text: Information about bug fixes and new features in the current version

maxindex.text: Main page for the Max tutorials

mspindex.text: Main page for the MSP tutorials

jitindex.text: Main page for the Jitter tutorials

shortcuts.text: Lists editing shortcuts in the patcher

listkeycommands.text: Displays a menu of patcher keyboard commands

keycommands.text: Describes keyboard commands for making new objects in a patcher

showattrs.text: Show an additional column in the inspector that displays the programmatic name of an object's attributes

revert.text: Sets the selected attribute to its value when the inspector was first opened on the object

scale.text: Places a sizing box around the selected objects permitting you to resize them as a group

scalespace.text: Places a sizing box around the selected objects permitting you to adjust the spacing between them

minimixer.text: Shows or hides the mini-mixer in patchers with audio objects

patchernavmenu.text: Display a menu to access parent patchers or create a new view of a patcher

viewbyicon.text: View objects in the explorer as categories of icons

viewbyname.text: View objects in the explorer by names and descriptions

showdetails.text: Show or hide panel providing additional information about the selected object

makeone.text: Place an instance of the selected object in the topmost patcher

explorer_option_createobjectbox.text: Create an object box when showing the object explorer

explorer_option_hideaftercreate.text: Hide the explorer after using it to create an object

explorer_option_movebelowtarget.text: Reposition the explorer near the location where you double-clicked to create an object

explorer_option_listexamples.text: Show patchers located in examples and docs folders in the object explorer

iconzoomin.text: Increase the size of objects in icon view

iconzoomout.text: Decrease the size of objects in icon view

explorer_gearmenu.text: Display a menu of object explorer preferences

inspector_gearmenu.text: Display a menu with commands for modifying the selected attribute

makeselectedattr.text: Create an attrui object that displays the selected attribute

refbar_ref.text: Display a complete reference page for the selected object

refbar_help.text: Open a help file for the selected object

compile.text: Generate code for this patcher window, disabled if compilation is up-to-date

build_autocompile.text: Enable or disable recompilation of this patcher whenever changes are made

build_reset.text: Re-initialize all parameter values to their default values

refbar_fwd.text: Show reference information for the next displayed object

refbar_back.text: Show reference information for the previously displayed object

attr_ref.text: Open the reference page for the object

object.head: Object Column Heading
object.text: Click to sort the window by object name

order.head: Order Column Heading
order.text: Click to sort the window by the order the message was posted

message.head: Message Column Heading
message.text: Click to sort the window by message text

ordercell.head: Message Order
ordercell.text: Shows the order in which the message was posted

slot.head: Slot Number
slot.text: An index number for the searchpath slot

name.head: Slot Name
name.text: Provides a label for the path that is added to Max's searchpath

path.head: Folder Path
path.text: Defines the actual path that is added to Max's searchpath

recursive.head: Recursive Path
recursive.text: If toggled to on, every sub-folder of the given path will be added. This can be very dangerous when adding an excessively large folder hierarchy, such the root of a hard drive or your Desktop.

columnheader.head: Column Heading
columnheader.text: Click to sort by this column or drag the column to rearrange it

_index.head: Index Column Heading
_index.text: Shows the order of messages up to the point where execution is stopped

patchersym.head: Patcher Column Heading
patchersym.text: Shows the name of the patcher in which each message is executed

senderclasssym.head: Sender Column Heading
senderclasssym.text: Shows the name of the object that is sending the message

classsym.head: Receiver Column Heading
classsym.text: Shows the name of the object that is receiving and executing the message

messagesym.head: Message Column Heading
messagesym.text: Shows the name of message being executed

arguments.head: Arguments Column Heading
arguments.text: Shows the arguments to the message being executed

monitor.head: Monitor Watchpoint
monitor.text: This watchpoint will print any messages travelling through the patch cord in the Watchpoints window

break_disabled.head: Break Watchpoint
break_disabled.text: This watchpoint (currently disabled) will suspend execution of your patch and show the current execution state in the Debugger window. In order for it to work you need to enable debugging in the Debug menu.

break_enabled.head: Break Watchpoint
break_enabled.text: This watchpoint (currently enabled) will suspend execution of your patch and show the current execution state in the Debugger window.

monitor_break.head: Monitor/Break Watchpoint
monitor_break.text: This watchpoint will print any messages travelling through the patch cord in the Watchpoints window and suspend execution of your patch and show the current execution state in the Debugger window.

number.head: Number Column Heading
number.text: This column shows the watchpoint number

action.head: Action Column Heading
action.text: This column shows the type of watchpoint: break, monitor, or break/monitor

classname.head: Sender Column Heading
classname.text: This column shows the name of the object that sent the message being watched

patchername.head: Patcher Column Heading
patchername.text: This column shows the name of the patcher containing the watchpoint

value.head: Value Column Heading
value.text: This column shows the last value observed for this watchpoint

count.head: Count Column Heading
count.text: This column shows the number of messages sent through this watchpoint

history.head: History Column Heading
history.text: This column shows the recent history of message values sent through this watchpoint

genericcell.head: Inspector Cell
genericcell.text: There are so many things you can do while trapped in a cell

toolheader.head: Attribute Menu Column Heading
toolheader.text: Click to sort by Natural attribute order

toolcell.head: Attribute Menu
toolcell.text: Click to get a menu of attribute editing commands

attrnameheader.head: Attribute Column Heading
attrnameheader.text: Click to sort by attribute name or drag to rearrange this column

attrnamecell.head: Attribute
attrnamecell.text: Click to select this attribute -- you can also drag it into a patcher

nameheader.head: Attribute Description Column Heading
nameheader.text: Click to sort by attribute description or drag to rearrange this column

namecell.head: Attribute Description
namecell.text: Click to select this attribute -- you can also drag it into a patcher

valueheader.head: Attribute Value Column Heading
valueheader.text: Click to sort by attribute description or drag to rearrange this column

parameter_order.head: Recall Order
parameter_order.text: Sets the order of recall of this parameter. Lower numbers are recalled first. The order of recall of parameters with the same order number is undefined.

parameter_path.head: Path To Parameter
parameter_path.text: This feature is debug-build only, so you will never see this message. If you insist, this is the moniker path to the parameter object from the top-level of the patcher hierarchy.

parameter_linknames.head: Link Parameter Name to Scripting Name
parameter_linknames.text: If enabled, the parameter's long name will be linked with the object's scripting name.

parameter_longname.head: Long Name
parameter_longname.text: The long name of the parameter. This name must be unique per patcher hierarchy.

parameter_shortname.head: Short Name
parameter_shortname.text: The short name of the parameter. This name is used for display in the user interface.

parameter_scriptname.head: Scripting Name
parameter_scriptname.text: The scripting name of the object. This name must be unique per patcher.

parameter_type.head: Type
parameter_type.text: The type of the parameter. In general, this will be Int (0-255), Float (32-bit float), Enum (enumerated list of values) or Blob (list). Some parameters do not support certain parameter types, in which case those types will be unavailable in the drop-down menu.

parameter_range.head: Range
parameter_range.text: The range of the parameter (for Int and Float types), or the members of the enumerated list (for Enum types). Range in unsupported for Blob parameters.

parameter_modmode.head: Clip Modulation Mode
parameter_modmode.text: The clip modulation mode of the parameter. Available modes depend on the parameter's type. Clip Modulation is unsupported for Enum and Blob parameter types.

parameter_modrange.head: Clip Modulation Range
parameter_modrange.text: The clip modulation range of the parameter, if modulation is enabled.

parameter_invisible.head: Visibility
parameter_invisible.text: Determines whether the parameter can be automated and/or stored.

parameter_speedlim.head: Speedlim
parameter_speedlim.text: Minimum time between reported changes in milliseconds.

parameter_defer.head: Defer Output
parameter_defer.text: If enabled, output always on the main thread.

parameter_initial_enable.head: Initial Value Enabled
parameter_initial_enable.text: If enabled, the parameter will be set to an initial value (as specified in the Initial Value column) when the patcher or device is loaded. Turn this on (or off, and then on again) to store the current value of the parameter as the initial value.

parameter_initial.head: Initial Value
parameter_initial.text: The parameter's initial value, if the Initial Value Enabled checkbox is enabled.

parameter_units.head: Custom Units
parameter_units.text: The string to use when displaying the parameter's value, if Unit Style is set to Custom. Simple symbols or sprintf-style strings may be used.

parameter_unitstyle.head: Unit Style
parameter_unitstyle.text: Parameters have a number of built-in display styles for their data. Choose between them from the drop-down menu.

parameter_exponent.head: Exponential Scaling
parameter_exponent.text: When set to a value other than 1., the parameter's input and output values will be exponentially scaled according to the factor entered in this column.

parameter_steps.head: Steps
parameter_steps.text: The number of steps available between the minimum and maximum values of a parameter. For instance, if the parameter has a range from 0.-64., with Steps set to 4, the user can only set the parameter to 0, 21.33, 42.66 and 64.

parameter_lval.head: Linear Value
parameter_lval.text: For Int, Float and Enum types, the linear value (without exponential scaling) of the parameter.
